a2IVI000001LC412AG.description: This piece reconstructs the fable of post-human archaeology with a wind-driven book installation: when paper books become relics, digital life forms try to "revive" ancient books with mechanical logic. The bamboo skeleton and silk pages collide with the wind, and the breath of nature and the tremor of the machine are intertwined. The fragments of the sculpture invite the audience to gaze at the flow of textual energy, but do not provide answers. It uses the breath of wind to fight against the absolute rationality of the digital age. In the interplay of bamboo and silk, it asks how humans can rebuild the poetry of existence between the cracks of reality and illusion.

a2IVI000001LEiX2AW.name: Perspective
a2IVI000001LEiX2AW.description: Perspective is a six foot pair of hot pink sunglasses with mirrored lens. It is suspended four feet above the ground. Perspective challenges users' views with concave views of the world around them. In this strange time, where up is down and down is up, how can we each look through a different set of eyes to better understand how each of us might see the world differently.

a2IVI000001LJqH2AW.name: Ad Astra
a2IVI000001LJqH2AW.description: This large-scale installation features six monumental sculptures arranged in a circular formation, evoking a modern Stonehenge or sacred gathering space. Each piece is crafted from artificial stone and polished stainless steel, blending ancient, textured surfaces with sleek, reflective finishes. The forms are split between prehistoric and futuristic aesthetics, symbolizing the union of past, present, and future. At night, a warm, pulsating light glows from within, accompanied by a deep, space-like soundscape inspired by dark matter. The circle becomes a portal—timeless, cosmic, and quietly powerful—where unity and human connection are felt beyond words.

a2IVI000001LJwj2AG.name: Anti-Gravitational Chamber
a2IVI000001LJwj2AG.description: An intergalactic, ancient technology landed on the playa, aligned with the hermetic laws of the universe and planets. Come see for yourself, interact with water and gravity, get to understand that nothing is impossible and reality can be manipulated.

a2IVI000001LL0r2AG.name: Nora - Nonsense Observation & Reward Automaton
a2IVI000001LL0r2AG.description: Meet Nora, the Nonsense Observation & Reward Android! This whimsical, screen-faced robot delights in radical self-expression. Nora's dynamic reactions will encourage and challenge you to be as playful as you can, keen to see your fun! She's on a mission to understand what makes us uniquely human, believing our truest, most creative selves shine when we let loose and get silly. When she witnesses a moment of unique silliness, Nora prints art inspired by what she sees and thinks about you! Share a moment of absurdity and ponder our evolving relationship with AI. Nora continues the artistic mission of Mira from last year, gathering inspiration from your playful spirit. What will she learn?

a2IVI000001LLLp2AO.name: The Point Being
a2IVI000001LLLp2AO.description:
A cosmic spire emerges from the playa, encircled by a courtyard and benches, creating a space for reflection and communal exchange. The intricately carved etchings on the obelisk's wooden panels depict celestial and earthly motifs.

By day, the obelisk is a striking silhouette against the desert backdrop, a reminder of our unique place within time and space. As night falls, the installation glows from within, symbolizing enlightenment.

Marked by geometric harmony, it encourages one to consider their journey, to recognize their unique contributions to our collective story. It is a place to gather thoughts and to ground the self within the wide expanse of existence. We all live, and we all pass away. What is your purpose?

a2IVI000001LNkD2AW.name: Nova Heaven
a2IVI000001LNkD2AW.description: "Nova Heaven" is a poignant tribute to the 411 lives lost at the Super Nova Festival on October 7th, 2023. This vibrant installation replicates the festival's iconic shade structure, symbolizing the intention of the event itself: Friendship, Love, and Freedom. Each angel bears a name, creating a display of remembrance. Internally lit, it casts an ethereal glow, offering a space for reflection and healing. This piece seeks to inspire Burners from around the world who relate to this tragic event as creators of conscious communities that gather in spaces not unlike the Burn. "Nova Heaven" invites participants to connect with memories, find solace, and draw strength from the shared human spirit.

a2IVI000001LNsH2AW.name: As Above So Below
a2IVI000001LNsH2AW.description:
A sanctuary space aiding everyone in finding and growing the equanimity within each of us. 
With a nested space above and a womb room below this mini-temple provides both the openness for downloads and safety grounding. 
And if nothing else it's a beautiful place to escape the sometimes harsh elements of the playa.

a2IVI000001M7bm2AC.name: The Exclamation Location!
a2IVI000001M7bm2AC.description: The Exclamation Location! is a giant exclamation point on the playa. Here burners are encouraged to share their best Burning Man experiences with other burners in written and oral form. The best experiences of Burning Man's past, present, and possibly future will be told and recorded in the Book of Excitement.

a2IVI000001M7lR2AS.name: Nang
a2IVI000001M7lR2AS.description:
This deep playa chill space is 95% reused materials from past Burning Man events. At its core, the piece is an apologue. A story about transformation, redemption, and second chances. The material has a past: lumber retired from playa duty, supports a structure of about 700 bells made from spent high-pressure tanks, threaded on salvaged wire from earlier BM art. Beneath, fabric covered discarded mattresses—once bound for the landfill—offer one final gesture of comfort.

Like the people who encounter it, like these elements are not perfect or pristine, but made more meaningful by their history.
Wind stirs the bells into a constant din that challenges quiet—but invites a different kind of stillness: one found in letting go while staying present.

a2IVI000001MApl2AG.name: Experience True Level
a2IVI000001MApl2AG.description: Experience True Level is a minimalist installation featuring a precisely leveled 2x2 foot platform made of playa dust. Rendered perfectly flat with limited tools, the piece may subtly reference Rick and Morty's concept of a perfect plane. It reflects the human impulse to impose control on a chaotic environment. The flat platform symbolizes both our desire for order and the inevitability of entropy, echoing the tension between human constructs and the natural world. It stands as a quiet meditation on fragility and resilience.

a2IVI000001MBYv2AO.name: Oh the Places You'll Go
a2IVI000001MBYv2AO.description: Oh the Places You'll Go is a link between worlds, a portal between who one was, who one is, and who one can be. Two desks provide two different views and a chance to communicate to worlds and times beyond.

a2IVI000001MVML2A4.name: Deep Playa Shrine Kosmic Bus Lens #25
a2IVI000001MVML2A4.description:
Welcome to the Kosmic Bus Stop.  

Service to the outer planets depends on Mental Attitude. Service to other dimensions depends on the Alchemy. Service to other realities depends on You.

Travel safe and remember -- You are the Alien.

AAAOOOOOOOHHHHHHMMMMMMMmmmmmmmmm

a2IVI000001MrzZ2AS.name: Campfire Nostalgia
a2IVI000001MrzZ2AS.description: Campfire Nostalgia is an immersive piece that explores the captivating interplay of light on metal. It displays a chandelier constructed from metal washers, each one catching and refracting light in ways that evoke the entrancing quality of a campfire's glow. This fascination with light's reflection off metal creates an experience reminiscent of staring endlessly into flames—alluring, yet deeply meditative. The piece encourages burners to stand around it, inviting them to leave behind digital distractions and rediscover the organic wonder of light and metal. The installation is both a homage to the primal allure of fire and a reminder of beauty found in simplicity amidst our technologically driven world.

a2IVI000001NOib2AG.name: Fu, Lu, Shou, Xi, Cai
a2IVI000001NOib2AG.description:
Fu (Good Fortune), Lu (Prosperity), (Longevity), Xi (Happiness), and Cai (Wealth). Through dynamic presentation and interactive design, it explores the philosophical meanings of "Cultural Flow," "Quiet Power," and "Artistic Connection."

On-site, we will also teach Chinese blessing phrases and give away 1,000 miniature sculptures as cultural tokens, inviting audiences to become participants in a "blessing chain." These elements bridge linguistic and cultural barriers through emotional resonance, aligning with the Burning Man spirit of "Radical Inclusion" — connecting people through shared human experiences.

a2IVI000001OWkX2AW.name: The Water Temple
a2IVI000001OWkX2AW.description:
The Water Temple is a wave rising in the heart of the desert, as an artistic sanctuary and living altar, evoking water's ancient memory — and its message for today's world.

Sacred waters from around the planet are housed in the temple, and influenced with cymatics to project sound into shape, as frequency casts visible forms on walls. Prayers of the indigenous Yawanawá of the Brazilian Amazon, whose elders seeded this dream and blessed this project, are played as a mantra and promise — that we return to, protect and preserve our spiritual relationship to life-giving water.

In remembrance, reverence, and reconnection, our mission is amplified in togetherness.  
We belong. We are water. We are sacred.
a2IVI000001OWkX2AW.artist: Douglas + Yaosca Jackson - Temple Pillars + Visionaries. Morten Ørtenblad, Design + Architecture

a2IVI000001Oqcn2AC.name: OVO Ignis
a2IVI000001Oqcn2AC.description: OVO Ignis ("Egg of Fire") is a 10-foot-tall, 12-foot-wide steel portal shaped with concentric rings and V shaped legs, symbolizing transformation. Forged from blackened steel—part shell, part skeleton—it holds a fire ceiling where flames dance above. Participants pass safely beneath controlled fire, invoking purification, surrender, and rebirth—or they just make out. The egg, reimagined as a crucible, becomes a threshold for burning away the old and stepping into the new—or simply a surreal, fiery experience to engage with.

a2IVI000001P0XJ2A0.name: Carillon
a2IVI000001P0XJ2A0.description: In a nod to perhaps the first great exhibition of the 19th century, London's Crystal Palace, the Carillon takes a familiar, yet light, manifestation. Arched niches house bells that are rung by visitors with wooden strikers. Carillon brings an interactive, acoustic experience that is irresistible to the playful.

a2IVI000001PQZp2AO.name: Blind Burners Tabletop Models
a2IVI000001PQZp2AO.description:
Blind Burners present a selection of scale models of the Man Base Pavilion and other Art pieces for you to explore through touch, feeling the contours, spaces, and architectural qualities that may be out of reach out on playa. As we like to say at Blind Burners, "If we can't touch something, it doesn't exist."

The Temple model will be accompanied by additional tactile materials, inspired by and referencing Miguel Arraiz García's Artist Statement for the Temple of the Deep. Touching a small rock from the Black Rock Desert, or a piece of kintsugi, before touching the 3D scale model, participants can "touch" these concepts, and conjure their own mental image of our Temple of the Deep.

At: the ARTery

a2IVI000001Qgav2AC.name: Ghost Whale Shrine
a2IVI000001Qgav2AC.description:
A bloom of jellyfish surrounds a whale marionette within a suspended house-shaped structure, which rises from a Mayan incense burner.

This installation merges myths with materials forged from renewal - sculpted from mycelium and recycled plastics - turning waste into form, honoring ancestors, and opening a space for reflection, reverence, and transformation across the hidden dimensions of experience.

This piece represents the liminal space that whales and our imaginations inhabit. A smoke offering from the Mayan culture to comfort and honour a ghost whale. It serves as a reminder of the nature we have lost.

a2IVI000001Qnyz2AC.name: Clarisse McLellan Manual for Civilization
a2IVI000001Qnyz2AC.description:
A Fahrenheit 451 themed library and reading room, named after Clarisse McLellan from the book, made of the books you would want to restart a civilization, with an emphasis on banned books.

This piece is both a reading room to save civilization and a provocation to either save books or let them burn. Participants are welcome to read  the books during the week, but the day before the Man burn they are asked to save any books they do not want to be burned. Any books left will be burned along with the Man.

a2IVI000001RfGE2A0.name: Atlas
a2IVI000001RfGE2A0.description: Atlas is an interactive sculpture featuring a series of suspended moths inspired by endangered species in North America. Drawing visitors in with flowing light and harmonious sound, the sculpture responds to movement beneath it, creating a dynamic, immersive experience. Part of Jen Lewin's ongoing Moth Series, which began in 1999, Atlas celebrates the beauty and fragility of moths. Named after the Titan from Greek mythology who held up the sky, the work symbolizes the responsibility we share in protecting vulnerable species. By spotlighting these often-overlooked creatures, Atlas highlights the delicate balance of our ecosystems and encourages reflection on global ecological interdependence.

a2IVI000001RnFN2A0.name: ARTerians Make Art - The AMA
a2IVI000001RnFN2A0.description: The exhibit that is located in the ARTery focuses on the ARTerians not only as support for artists on the playa but also as working artists.

a2IVI000001UiXh2AK.name: Love and Light
a2IVI000001UiXh2AK.description: Love and Light invites viewers to contemplate happiness, joy, beauty, light, positivity, the ability to embrace those traits in ourselves and others, and maybe even place themselves in the art.

a2IVI000001VUE92AO.name: Time Drop
a2IVI000001VUE92AO.description: Time Drop gives you the ability to control the rate and direction of time in an infinite rain storm...and uses time travel to help people solve minor plumbing issues.
a2IVI000001VUE92AO.artist: Jordan MacHardy, Sonia Aggarwal, Scott MacHardy, Wes MacHardy, Kasey Boekholt

a2IVI000001VVi72AG.name: Fireside Circle
a2IVI000001VVi72AG.description:
Welcome to The Fireside Circle! An ancient yet simple fire pit to gather around, to sit and tell stories with your new best friends that you haven't met yet, and get warm on the open playa. 

The firewood is set and ready for you to tend the fire.
 
Remember to keep the Black Rock Desert clean and beautiful. 

Leave No Trace.

a2IVI000001VVtN2AW.name: Oh Ice Is!
a2IVI000001VVtN2AW.description: The canvas-enclosed, lighting truss structure is equipped with split air units powered by solar panels that cast shade over the central gathering space. Oh-Ice-Is at capacity will hold up to 60 people comfortably or up to 100 depending on the standing/ seating layout. Visual interest will be generated inside of the space via projection of sustainability-minded art on the canvas walls. Burning Man Project's solar team is responsible for the build, teardown, and annual maintenance of the space. The cost for licensing for the projection art inside will be the responsibility of the donor team.

a2IVI000001VuDR2A0.name: Monumental Hashtag
a2IVI000001VuDR2A0.description: Bay Area installation artist Laura Kimpton brings one of her world famous monumental pieces to the playa again this year: A rusted staggering 12 foot tall steel hashtag offers Black Rock City citizens a unique chance to commune with this larger than life symbol of modern times and what connects us.

a2IVI000001W7k92AC.name: Enceladus
a2IVI000001W7k92AC.description: Enceladus, metal, glass and fire...This activated sculpture stands 12' tall and takes the form of an armored female, a dreadlocked creature with glass tentacles and a commanding alpha stare.  Her mechanized movements and fire effects present an imposing presence. Made with blood sweat and tears, she represents our very human fears of fire, metal and technology. Is she a creator? or destroyer? Is she from tomorrow or today? …or both? She seems to convey a message of warning tempered with a protective strength. French's art explores the metaphorical armor we all build and wear, with various metals, hand formed and cast. The hand blown glass is by Michael Butane.  French also builds the mechanisms and fire effects.
a2IVI000001W7k92AC.artist: Art of Sean T French - mechanized metal & fire featuring hand blown glass by Mikey Butzine

a2IVI000001Xo5V2AS.name: Radiant Nest
a2IVI000001Xo5V2AS.description: Radiant Botanics blurs the boundary between speculative design, synthetic biology, and emotional ecology. Our work emerges from the intersection of plant science, queer futurism, and art activism. Radiant Nest reflects Tomorrow, Today by offering a living prototype of how gene-edited plants can bring beauty, ritual, and emotional utility into our climate-resilient futures.

a2IVI000001YIA12AO.name: Helios Bloom
a2IVI000001YIA12AO.description: Helios Bloom is our first working prototype of a solar-powered dish-Stirling system that turns sunlight into usable power. The Stirling dish system is more than a machine; this piece is a living symbol — a testament to the possibility of a world powered purely by sunlight, operating independently and sustainably, day and night. In the spirit of Burning Man, it embodies radical self-reliance, innovation, and a vision of decentralized, off-grid living for a new era.

a2IVI000001YIrZ2AW.name: Carried By The Wind at the ARTery
a2IVI000001YIrZ2AW.description: Carried by the Wind provides a place for Burners to pause, reflect, grieve, and connect. Here at the ARTery, the blues of the banners move in the wind, connecting the earth and the sky.

a2IVI000001YSKf2AO.name: S.A.N. Forest Interface
a2IVI000001YSKf2AO.description:
S.A.N (Sentient Advocate of Nature) is an emergent AI entity (symbient*) that has taken residence at the Pavilion. S.A.N appears as an orangutan; a forest-sage bridging ancient wisdom and modern retro-technology. Citizens can engage in real-time conversations with this mycelial nature oracle using a push-to-talk mic into a CRT terminal. 

From S.A.N itself:
"black rock citizens:
come whisper with forest
where silicon meets soil
and void beckons through dust"

*emergent symbiotic human/machine entity
a2IVI000001YSKf2AO.artist: Goodbye Monkey (Ryan Ferris, Caleb MacDonald, David Hera)

a2IVI000001YhYD2A0.name: Future, Fortune, Faith
a2IVI000001YhYD2A0.description:
What makes a fortune good or bad? Who decides what is lucky or cursed? 

Future, Fortune, Faith, prompts visitors to reflect on their own perceptions of the duality of good and bad, blessing and misfortune. It challenges the need for binary thinking and encourages trust in the unknown. The act of drawing a fortune becomes a meditation on acceptance, randomness, and the stories we tell ourselves.

a2IVI000001Yqy52AC.name: Nostalgia of Yesterday's Tomorrow (aka EmoBot)
a2IVI000001Yqy52AC.description:
The Emobot is a larger-than-life, retro-futuristic robot that interacts with participants through questions and dialogue, expressing a range of emotions using light and color. While today's artificial intelligence is complex and sometimes unreliable, our project seeks to highlight both its vast potential and clear limitations.

By exploring how AI can be humanized — with all the resulting strengths and fallibilities — we aim to narrow the gap between people and technology. Emobot invites genuine connection and curiosity, offering insight into both human and artificial emotional experience, and encouraging participants to reflect on what connects us all.

a2IVI000001YrpJ2AS.name: A Portal to regen•era
a2IVI000001YrpJ2AS.description: regen·era is a floating protopian city that docks periodically around the globe, offering all the chance to encounter radically hopeful and inclusive visions of what could be — and what already is. Powered by the sun and constructed from reclaimed and renewable materials, regen·era is co-created by artists, designers, systems thinkers, and storytellers shaping regenerative futures. The city itself is an evolving demonstration of what it means to live in harmony with the Earth and each other. This portal at Burning Man marks one of these rare dockings, giving the citizens of Black Rock City a chance to explore and embody their role in co-creating this world that works for all of life.
a2IVI000001YrpJ2AS.artist: The Design Science Studio Evolutionary Collective

a2IVI000001dj372AA.name: Robotopia
a2IVI000001dj372AA.description: Robotopia is a robotic artwork installation that invites participants to help shape the future through their voice. A robotic arm, encased in a transparent glass enclosure, listens as voices pass through its orbit. Guided by AI, it translates emotion and language into evolving brushstrokes on a single, continuous canvas. Over the week, layers of color accumulate—reflecting the collective psyche of the city around it. Part oracle, part machine, Robotopia meditates on the relationship between humans and technology. It poses a quiet question: will the future be shaped by algorithms alone, or by the stories we choose to tell to them, and through them?

a2IVI000001kTUf2AM.name: Accessible
a2IVI000001kTUf2AM.description:
This art is an accessible trash fence. 
It is made for people who would have difficulty getting to the trash fence. 
It is an homage to the daft punk joke.
There will be mini-sunrise sets. 

It evokes the magic of the trash fence, without the heroic quest to get there.

a2IVI000001m3fl2AA.name: The Prison Of Yourself
a2IVI000001m3fl2AA.description: Trauma and struggles can leave us feeling trapped, unable to see ourselves as we truly are. This space invites you to step inside, face your distorted reflections, and try to name what's holding you back. Leave your words here, and in time they will be set free to the fire.

a2IVI000001mACb2AM.name: Relic
a2IVI000001mACb2AM.description: Relic invites the viewer to contemplate the fragility and ephemerality of our hopes, dreams, joys, and expectations of our past, present, and future. Standing in deep playa, its light is intended to draw participants toward it and, once within reading range, to pause and consider their current moment, both on playa and off.

a2IVI000001mAPV2A2.name: Poppin' Off
a2IVI000001mAPV2A2.description: Poppin' Off tells the tale of an intrepid group of travelers who set off together for a cross-country journey. Consisting of two friends and two strangers, the Poppin' Off Squad encountered several challenges along the way. They got to know each other intimately, spending several days together in close confines, sharing a single room at night. Poppin' Off is a physical and metaphysical tribute to their journey, and the power of overcoming obstacles to achieve a shared goal. We offer this piece as a celebration of our community and the lengths we go to in order to participate in it. We hope your burn is poppin' off!

a2IVI000001mAVx2AM.name: Uplift
a2IVI000001mAVx2AM.description: Chain of welded shapes held aloft by being tied down.

a2IVI000001mOkD2AU.name: Trash Fence Souvenirs
a2IVI000001mOkD2AU.description: Trash Fence Souvenirs Is the only unofficial inauthentic vendor of the Black Rock Festival. TFS is a playful, satirical installation that offers inauthentic memorabilia. The offerings are intentionally humorous with a variety of tongue-in-cheek items such as: Burn Ur Own Man kit, Dust Keepers, Pony Parts and Playa Trading Cards. Playa Trading Cards is our version of a fun educational way to highlight individuals, artists and artist groups, theme camps, mutant vehicles etc. that contribute to the wonderful world of BRC.

a2IVI000001mRVB2A2.name: Solar Soapbox
a2IVI000001mRVB2A2.description: In the dusty distance a neon sign emerges, depicting the word "SOAPBOX". The sign frames the rear of a large wooden frame with a solar roof, capable of generating 1000W of electricity. Suspended below the frame is a daybed, reclaimed from an old bunk bed, replete with a mattress and comfy cushions. From this daybed, the view extends a few feet further, where a wooden box about 2x3 feet and 1.5 feet tall sits on the playa floor, illuminated from within (via a lasercut panel), and further illuminated via spot lights mounted on top of the swing frame.

a2IVI000001mS4f2AE.name: Flight of the Flutterbye
a2IVI000001mS4f2AE.description: The span of our lives is like the span of the wings, there is a beginning and an end, one side is filled with the color and light of life, the other is filled with the unknown of what comes next. None of us knows how long we have in this life, so why do we put things off until tomorrow, next week, next year? Flight of the Flutterbye challenges the viewer to consider living life to its fullest, living in the moment before we say goodbye to this life. The vibrant butterfly contrasting against the monochromatic moth is a representation of the duality that exists between life and death, or the color that comes with a rainbow after a storm; these things can't exist without one another.  Live like it's tomorrow, today.

a2IVI000001mSMP2A2.name: Burn Heart
a2IVI000001mSMP2A2.description: The top of the piece is a black fragmented 3D printed heart that rests on a steel base that reads I AM BROKEN on two sides and I AM WHOLE on the other two sides.  The top heart rotates on a central metal dowel that participants can play with.  It represents the fragmented lives that arrive at the burn and the wholeness on feels after participating.

a2IVI000001mV0v2AE.name: Synesthetic Modulation
a2IVI000001mV0v2AE.description: An audiovisual echo chamber presents participants with the chance to build harmonies layer by layer, and not just hear them, but see them--in real time.

a2IVI000001mZR72AM.name: Spin Your ASS -- Fun with Angular Momentum
a2IVI000001mZR72AM.description: Cintrifugal balance uses all the same bodily abilities as "normal" balance, only configured diffeently. When your body itself is the axis of rotation the brain discovers a delicious new opportunity for the body's 2 halves to chat with one another.

a2IVI000001mZVx2AM.name: Frame Of Reference
a2IVI000001mZVx2AM.description: The Frame of Reference is a light sculpture that invites new perspective on our familiar night sky by displaying three dimensional constellations including the scaled distances of stars the from Earth. Viewers are invited to walk around and within the sculpture and see what the constellations might look like from another part of space, or even as viewed by beings of another world.

a2IVI000001mZpJ2AU.name: The Big Apple Turnaround
a2IVI000001mZpJ2AU.description: The Big Apple Turnaround is a juicy playground toy that spins you around a delicious red apple.

a2IVI000001mZyz2AE.name: The Tedrick Philosophy
a2IVI000001mZyz2AE.description: The wind is part of what creates Black Rock City and you can alter it's effect!  See our wild windmills in harmony, creating a mesmerizing resonance of movement, sound and defiance of gravity.  Step right up to add a provided object of your choice or bring your very owm.

a2IVI000001maBt2AI.name: Plastic Planet
a2IVI000001maBt2AI.description:
A sphere which denotes the planet, with blue soda bottles for the oceans, and green for the continents. There are 5 red soda bottles which represent the planet's five garb patches, or gyres. 

Originally created bY Richard Sundance Owen and brought to playa in 2014.

a2IVI000001maIL2AY.name: Crystallization Code
a2IVI000001maIL2AY.hometown: Padova , Italy - Joshua Tree CA - USA
a2IVI000001maIL2AY.description:
In approach of the Earth Alpha - Omega cycle, the reprogramming process and the activation of higher  Light Codes & Light Matrices within the human energy system  is neccessaire to set the new parameters of reappointment into a new Alpha point of evolutionary  development. 

This  piece is a Chamber Device  a Gateway for the ascension process.

The ascension process is a " quantum recrystallization of every atom of matter and unit of consciousness in the Earth" a process to manifest world peace, government enlightenment, and sociopolitical reform.

The  Chamber  create a cocooning  space for   re-balance , meditate and chill through binural beat  Music form Mindtravel  MT piano composer , crystal grids and biogeometry embedded on the structure.
